resources.name: 1. List Projects
resources.description: Get all projects for authenticated user (ordered by updated_at DESC)

resources.name: 2. Create Project
resources.description: Create a new project â†’ saves project_id

resources.name: 3. Get Project by ID
resources.description: Retrieve a specific project â†’ refreshes project_id

resources.name: 4. Update Project Name
resources.description: Rename a project (updates updated_at automatically)

resources.name: 5. Delete Project (Empty)
resources.description: Delete a project with no documents â†’ returns 204

resources.name: 6. Delete Project (Has Documents)
resources.description: Attempt to delete project with documents â†’ returns 409 Conflict

resources.name: 7. [VAL] Empty Name
resources.description: Test validation: should reject empty name â†’ 400

resources.name: 8. [VAL] Name Too Long
resources.description: Test validation: should reject name over 255 chars â†’ 400

resources.name: 9. Get Project Tree
resources.description: Get the nested folder/document tree for a project

resources.name: 1. Create Root Folder
resources.description: Create a folder at root level. May return nothing if already exists (idempotent).

resources.name: 2. Get Folder (captures ID)
resources.description: Get folder details. Use this to capture folder_id if CREATE returned nothing.

resources.name: 3. Create Subfolder
resources.description: Create a nested folder inside the parent folder.

resources.name: 4. Rename Folder
resources.description: Change the name of a folder (stays at same level)

resources.name: 5. Move Subfolder to Root
resources.description: Move the subfolder to root level (set folder_id to empty string)

resources.name: 6. Delete Folder
resources.description: Delete a folder (cascades to child folders/documents)

resources.name: 1. Create Document (Simple - folder_path only)
resources.description: External AI pattern: Create with folder_path only, auto-creates folders

resources.name: 2. Get Document (captures ID)
resources.description: Get document by ID. Use this to capture document_id if CREATE returned nothing.

resources.name: 3. Create Document (Optimized - folder_id + folder_path)
resources.description: Frontend pattern: Pass folder_id for speed, folder_path as backup

body.text:
{
  "project_id": "{{ _.project_id }}",
  "folder_path": "Characters",
  "folder_id": "{{ _.folder_id }}",
  "name": "Professor Thorne",
  "content": "# Professor Thorne\n\nAn enigmatic teacher with secrets to hide.\n\n- Age: Unknown\n- Element: All"
}

resources.name: 4. Create Root Document
resources.description: Create a document at root level (empty folder_path)

resources.name: 5. Update Document Content
resources.description: Update the content of a document (name and folder stay the same)

resources.name: 6. Rename Document
resources.description: Change the name of a document (stays in same folder)

resources.name: 7. Move Document via folder_path
resources.description: Move document using folder_path (auto-creates folders if needed)

resources.name: 8. Move Document to Folder
resources.description: Move root document into a folder (uses folder_id)

resources.name: 9. Move Document to Root
resources.description: Move document to root level (set folder_id to empty string)

resources.name: 10. Delete Document
resources.description: Delete a document by ID

resources.name: 1. [INTEGRATION] Auto-Create Nested Folders
resources.description: Create document with deep folder path - auto-creates all folders

resources.name: 2. [INTEGRATION] Create Folder Then Document
resources.description: Manual folder creation, then add document using folder_id

resources.name: 3. [INTEGRATION] Add Document to Folder
resources.description: Create document using folder_id from previous request

body.text:
{
  "project_id": "{{ _.project_id }}",
  "folder_id": "{{ _.weapons_folder_id }}",
  "folder_path": "Weapons",
  "name": "Stormcaller Blade",
  "content": "# Stormcaller Blade\n\nA legendary sword that channels lightning."
}

resources.name: 4. [PATH] Folder - Relative Path
resources.description: Create folder using relative path notation: 'Characters/Villains' creates both folders

resources.name: 5. [PATH] Folder - Absolute Path
resources.description: Create folder using absolute path notation: '/Magic/Spells' ignores folder_id

resources.name: 6. [PATH] Document - Relative Path
resources.description: Create document using relative path notation in name field

resources.name: 7. [PATH] Document - Absolute Path
resources.description: Create document using absolute path notation (ignores folder_id)

resources.name: 8. [PATH] Validation Errors
resources.description: Test edge cases - should return 400 for invalid paths like 'a//b', 'a/', etc.

resources.name: 1. Import Merge (Simple Zip)
resources.description: Merge mode: Upsert documents from zip file. Auto-creates folders, updates existing docs.

params.name: files
params.description: Upload a zip file containing markdown documents

resources.name: 2. Import Merge (Nested Folders)
resources.description: Import zip with nested folder structure (e.g. Characters/Villains/doc.md)

resources.name: 3. Import Merge (Duplicate Names - Upsert)
resources.description: Import documents that already exist - should UPDATE existing docs, not fail

params.name: files
params.description: Upload zip with same names as existing docs

resources.name: 4. View Tree (After Merge)
resources.description: Visualize project structure after merge import

resources.name: 5. Import Replace (Clear All First)
resources.description: Replace mode: DELETE all existing documents, then import. Dangerous!

params.name: files
params.description: Upload zip file that will REPLACE all existing content

resources.name: 6. View Tree (After Replace)
resources.description: Verify old content deleted, only new content exists

resources.name: 7. [EDGE] Empty Zip File
resources.description: Import empty zip - should succeed with 0 documents

resources.name: 8. [EDGE] Invalid Zip Structure
resources.description: Import zip with invalid content - should report errors gracefully

resources.name: 9. [EDGE] Document Name Sanitization
resources.description: Import documents with slashes in names - should sanitize to hyphens

params.name: files
params.description: Upload zip with docs named 'Hero/Villain.md' (should become 'Hero-Villain')

resources.name: 10. [EDGE] No Files Provided
resources.description: Call import endpoint without any files - should return 400 error

resources.name: 1. Create Deeply Nested Document
resources.description: Create a document with deep path - auto-creates all folders in hierarchy

resources.name: 2. View Full Tree
resources.description: See the entire folder/document tree structure created

resources.name: 3. Create Folder Then Document
resources.description: First create a folder, then add document to it using folder_id

resources.name: 4. Add Document to Folder
resources.description: Create document using folder_id (from previous step)

resources.name: 5. Create Archive Folder
resources.description: Create an Archive folder to reorganize documents

resources.name: 6. Move Document to Archive
resources.description: Move Chapter 1 to the Archive folder
resources.afterResponseScript: console.log('âœ… Document moved to Archive folder');

resources.name: 7. View Final Structure
resources.description: See the final reorganized tree structure

resources.name: 1. [VAL] Folder Name with Slash
resources.description: Should FAIL: folder names cannot contain slashes (400 validation error)

resources.name: 2. [VAL] Rename Folder with Slash
resources.description: Should FAIL: folder names cannot contain slashes (400 validation error)

resources.name: 3. [VAL] Document without folder_path or folder_id
resources.description: Should FAIL: must provide at least one of folder_path or folder_id (400)

resources.name: 4. [VAL] Project with Empty Name
resources.description: Should FAIL: project name is required (400)

resources.name: 5. [VAL] Project Name Too Long
resources.description: Should FAIL: project name exceeds max length (400)

resources.name: 1. [PRIORITY] Create - folder_id Wins
resources.description: When both folder_id and folder_path provided, folder_id takes priority

body.text:
{
  "project_id": "{{ _.project_id }}",
  "folder_path": "Characters",
  "folder_id": "{{ _.folder_id }}",
  "name": "Priority Test Document",
  "content": "# Testing Priority\n\nThis document should be in the folder_id location, NOT Characters."
}

resources.name: 2. [PRIORITY] Move - folder_id Wins
resources.description: When both folder_id and folder_path provided in update, folder_id wins

resources.name: 1. [ERROR] Delete Project with Documents
resources.description: Should FAIL: Cannot delete project that has documents (409 conflict)

resources.name: 2. [ERROR] Get Nonexistent Document
resources.description: Should return 404 for document that doesn't exist

resources.name: 3. [ERROR] Get Nonexistent Folder
resources.description: Should return 404 for folder that doesn't exist

resources.name: 4. [ERROR] Create Duplicate Folder Name
resources.description: Should FAIL: Cannot create folder with same name in same location (409 conflict)

resources.name: 5. [ERROR] Create Duplicate Document Name
resources.description: Should FAIL: Cannot create document with same name in same folder (409 conflict)

resources.name: Projects
resources.description: Project CRUD operations + tree

resources.description: Folder CRUD operations

resources.name: Documents
resources.description: Document CRUD operations

resources.name: Integration
resources.description: Cross-feature integration tests

resources.name: Import - Merge Mode
resources.description: Upsert documents (create or update existing)

resources.name: Import - Replace Mode
resources.description: Delete all, then import (dangerous!)

resources.name: Import - Edge Cases
resources.description: Error handling and validation tests for import

resources.name: Workflows
resources.description: Realistic end-to-end user scenarios

resources.name: Edge Cases - Validations
resources.description: Input validation tests (should return 400)

resources.name: Edge Cases - Priority Tests
resources.description: Test folder_id vs folder_path priority logic

resources.name: Edge Cases - Error Paths
resources.description: Error handling tests (404, 409, etc.)

resources.name: 01 - File System
resources.description: Complete file system operations: projects, folders, documents, import, workflows, and edge cases
